triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: Twitter is the primary data source used by the paper to analyze user demographics and characteristics.

triples.name: Demography
triples.relevance: The paper develops novel techniques to analyze and compare the demographics of Twitter users with the U.S. population.

triples.name: Social media analytics
triples.relevance: The paper proposes techniques for extracting and analyzing demographic insights from Twitter data, a core application of social media analytics.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes a sample of over 1% of the U.S. population from Twitter and compares it to the overall population using sampling principles.

triples.name: Geographic information system
triples.relevance: Geographic analysis is one of the three key axes of demographic comparison performed in the paper.

triples.name: Ethnicity
triples.relevance: Race and ethnicity is one of the three key demographic axes analyzed to compare Twitter users with the U.S. population.
